history.text: Hi there!
Hey buddy, what's up?
This looks like a good movie.
Yeah, it does. Did you enjoy anything about it in particular?
Haven't seen it yet, but the actors look good!
Jeff Bridges is usually good.  I can see the comedic relief in his trying to take out Iron Man
Yeah, Robert Downey Jr. really held the movie together.
Awesome.  I haven't really seen him in anything except older movies.
Looks like it got a lot of great reviews
Looks like Gwyneth Paltrow's part wasn't really deep?
She didn't really play a huge role, no.
How did you feel about the special effects?
Apparently they were extreme!
The early plot line with Stark being in Afghanistan to sell his Jericho missile seems captivating.
I think it was a product of the times. It seems out of place now, didn't really age all that well.
Do you typically watch superhero movies?
I don't get into Marvel too much.  However, I should probably give this a shot.
I like the Avengers though
Yeah, it feels like a lot of people do these days. I don't really like any Marvel movies, I feel they're all the same with different characters.
exactly
So, apparently according to the dossier Ten Rings is a mercenary hit group.  Did they do anything of any real interest?
So, according to the responses.....  a military thriller?  As a comic book/ marvel movie?
There's a loose military tie in outside of the forced early plot where he builds the suit.
Gotcha
I wouldn't really call it a military thriller, other than there's some references to Tony building weapons for the military.
LOL.   I don't think this is one that I will be seeing anytime soon.

I really don't have anything else to say regarding this.  I know a lot of people liked the movie.
\
Would you watch a bad movie with friends if it was widely enjoyed like this one?
yes
but now that it is so old (unless it came on Netflix or someone already had it) I don't think that I would pay for it.
Ah!  More scenes to review
LOL... you are right.  A lot of comic book/ super hero movies tend to repeat the same formula.
"top of the building"
I am guessing the name "Iron Man" comes from his magnet?
What other S.H.I.E.L.D. agents were there?
While that powers his suit, it comes mostly from it being made of metal. It wasn't even really made of iron, but it was a convenient and catchy name to use.
ok
I don't remember any SHIELD agents being used in the movie. If they were, they were just something to reference.
Well, i have to say that the idea of the magnet keeping the shards of metal from reaching Stark's heart in the beginning of the movie was an intriguing one.
OK... well the SHEILD agents were referenced in the paper
Yeah, they were just sort of no name actors playing background characters. They weren't really fleshed out until The Avengers.
OK.  Well that makes sense.
Thanks
Yeah, the scenes that interacted with the magnet in his heart were one of the better plot points in most of the Marvel movies.
